me.aliceq.garbler

Class GarblerLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aliceq.garbler.GarblerLibrary

  • public final class GarblerLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing analyzers for a Garbler program. In addition, a library contains an input filter used to interpret analyzed text.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_DELIM 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GarblerLibrary()
      Creates an instance with no output filter and a case-insensitive input filter.
      GarblerLibrary(GarblerTranslator filter)
      Creates an instance with custom input and output filters

          int maxWords)

      • analyze

        public int analyze(java.lang.String text,
          java.lang.String delim)

      • analyze

        public int analyze(java.lang.String text,
          java.lang.String delim,
          int maxWords)
        Runs a word through all GarblerAnalyzers stored. Note that after this is run no more analyzers may be added.
        Parameters:
        text - a series of words to analyze
        delim - regex delimiter to use for separating words, or null to use the default
        maxWords - the maximum number of words to extract
        Returns:
        the number of words that were garbled

      • analyzeFromFile

        public int analyzeFromFile(java.lang.String filepath)

                  java.lang.String delim)

      • analyzeFromFile

        public int analyzeFromFile(java.lang.String filepath,

      • analyzeFromFile

        public int analyzeFromFile(java.lang.String filepath,
                  java.lang.String delim,
                  int maxWords)
        Reads in a file line-by-line and analyzes each line.Note that after this is run no more analyzers may be added.
        Parameters:
        filepath - location of the file to read
        delim - regex to use for separating words, or null to use the default
        maxWords - the maximum number of words to extract
        Returns:
        the number of words analyzed

      • analyzeFromFile

        public int analyzeFromFile(java.io.File file)

                  int maxWords)

                  java.lang.String delim)

      • analyzeFromFile

        public int analyzeFromFile(java.io.File file,
                  java.lang.String delim,
                  int maxWords)
        Reads in a file line-by-line and analyzes each line. Note that after this is run no more analyzers may be added.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to read
        delim - regex to use for separating words, or null to use the default
        maxWords - the maximum number of words to extract
        Returns:
        the number of words that were garbled

      • addAnalyzer

        public void addAnalyzer(java.lang.String key,
               GarblerAnalyzer analyzer)
        Adds an analyzer under the given key to the library
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the analyzer
        analyzer - the analyzer to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this is called after analysis has begun

      • getAnalyzer

        public GarblerAnalyzer<java.lang.Comparable> getAnalyzer(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the analyzer corresponding to the given key
        Parameters:
        key - key to check
        Returns:
        a GarblerAnalyzer instance or null

      • run

        public void run(GarblerScript script,
       int wordCount)
        Runs a script to generate a new sentence with this instance as its context
        Parameters:
        script - script to run
        wordCount - number of words to generate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if nothing has been analyzed

      • run

        public void run(GarblerScript script,
       int wordCount,
       char separator)
        Runs a script to generate a new sentence with this instance as its context
        Parameters:
        script - script to run
        wordCount - number of words to generate
        separator - separator to place between words
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if nothing has been analyzed

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all data from the library and analyzers but retains the current analyzer set. This also releases the adding block so new analyzers may be added.

      • analyzedCount

        public int analyzedCount()
        Gets the number of words that have been analyzed
        Returns:
        the number of words that have been analyzed

      • selfFeed

        public void selfFeed(boolean enable)
        If the library is self-feeding, it will automatically analyze any sentences it generates. This leads to more chaotic lines as more sentences are generated.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable self-feeding

      • isSelfFeeding

        public boolean isSelfFeeding()
        Checks whether or not the library is self-feeding
        Returns:
        true if the library self-feeds

      • loadDefaults

        public void loadDefaults()
        Loads the default set of analyzers. These are the following under the given keys:

        LETTERS : LetterInfluenceAnalyzer
        WORDLENGTH : WordLengthDistributionAnalyzer
        FIRSTCHAR : InitialCharDistributionAnalyzer
        ENDINGS : WordEndAnalyzer
        CHARCORRELATION : WordLengthCorrelationAnalyzer

      • loadDefaults

        public void loadDefaults(int radius,
                float letterInfluence)
        Loads the default set of analyzers. These are the following under the given keys:

        LETTERS : LetterInfluenceAnalyzer
        WORDLENGTH : WordLengthDistributionAnalyzer
        FIRSTCHAR : InitialCharDistributionAnalyzer
        ENDINGS : WordEndAnalyzer
        CHARCORRELATION : WordLengthCorrelationAnalyzer

        Parameters:
        radius - radius of influence
        letterInfluence - letter influence factor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if radius is less than 2

      • analyzers

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> analyzers()
        Returns a set of the keys currently containing analyzers
        Returns:
        a set of String keys

        public java.lang.String toString()
